page.title: 16CROP GROWING: ACTON/L'HAM
page.content: Area comprises approx. 3000 acres, di- vided into 10 farms of 200 acres or less and one of 1000 acres. Main crops in order of acreage grown are wheat, barley, oats, oil seed rape, peas beans and sugar beet. Harvest completed the grain is stored on the farms and sold as and where the market dictates in lots of 1000 tons. Wheat is milled solely for domestic use. Beans are grown for cattle food and peas are marketed as dried peas. The clay soil is self-sufficient in potash but nitrogen and phosphates are added in spring. Land is drained regu- larly, the small farms using contrac- tors. All farm machinery (combine har- vesters, crop sprayers, tractors, etc) are owned by the farmer. EEC rules and regulations have not to any great extent curtailed the acreage of cereals grown in this area.
